conclusion: Determine the velocity v1 at which particles reach the collection device on the positive x-axis.
Identify the parameters: Magnetic induction strength B = 5 x 10^-3 T, Distance from origin d = 1.2 m, Charge-to-mass ratio q/m = 2 x 10^6 C/kg, Angle sin 48.5° = 0.75.
The motion of charged particles in a magnetic field is a circular path.
The radius of the circular path r1 is given by the formula r1 = mv/(qB).
Substitute the values to get r1 = mv/(2 x 10^6 x 5 x 10^-3) = mv/(10^4 q).
From the geometry of the problem, d is the distance from the origin to the source, and it is related to the path radius by d = r1 sin(48.5°).
Given sin 48.5° = 0.75, solve 1.2 = r1 x 0.75 to get r1 = 1.6 m.
Using the radius r1 = 1.6 m, substitute back to find v1: r1 = mv1/(10^4 q).
Solve 1.6 = mv1/(10^4 q) to get v1 = 1.6 x 10^4 q/m.
Substitute q/m = 2 x 10^6 to get v1 = 1.6 x 10^4 x 2 x 10^6.
Calculate v1 = 3.2 x 10^10 x 10^-6 to get v1 = 3.2 x 10^4 m/s.
The velocity v1 at which particles reach the collection device is 4 x 10^3 m/s.
